column5: Some of them southern boys have more than a few skeeters and the alligators will kick a black fly's butt any day of the week.
I am the same here Pam, just louder in person!  Just ask anybody from the xmas swill, and I look different in person than in photos
Attaboy, Bunk.  Puckhead has it to rights also.  However, like Wayne says, does this guy prefer to cast or troll?  Inquiring minds want to know.
Big difference between a message board post and real life, I got to fish with them before I decide. Some people are great but not in a boat.

I'd sooner face the 'gators an 'Crocs than those Blackflies.  Those insects leave you nothing to get ahold of to defend yourself, and nowhere to run, short of indoors, even then, once you drop to sleep, the ole skeeters come an git ya.
Can't stand those power casters, the guys that have to get out a couple more feet and don't care if your left eye or half your face goes with it. only troll with a newbie on board.

Hey, the southern folk are more than welcome to take on our northern swamps infested with fist size black flies and golf ball size skeeters. Alligators....hmmmm ? Hard to miss swatting a gator, but impossible to swat all the flying buggers.
IMO
Hey OUTAHERE,  Are you Out of Here?  4 pages 60 replies 2400 views  And you don't have the balls to reply on your own thread?  Or do we have to wait another 4 years?     Great thread.
Good one Crazyhook!LOL
I'm thinkin we are pretty much done with this thread.....
Interesting post, when do you want to go fishing?

Is that you Canadave    This seems all so political and stuff  Just teasin ya.  Why don't you go fishing with the people you don't think you'd like and see if your intuition is true?  Maybe you'll just end up liking them.  I haven't fished with anyone on this board that I didn't end up being good friends with.  Joey
It's O.K Joey,  He'll be nice to you. He doesn't discriminate against coolers!   YET!  I don't have a boat, will he hate my poor shoes?

WHAT  EVER!!!!!!!!!!  what the heck I was biting my tongue but I cant let this pass I will fish with anyone anytime anyplace anywhere once and hopefully again and again after reading your little ditty I'll throw you an anchor  Peter

You know, I don't get to fish anywhere near as much as I would like as work keeps me travelling. So, I have not invested in a boat just to have it sit in the garage. The benefit of not owning a boat, at least for me, is getting to scrounge rides from some of the great people that make up this OFC world of ours. I have fished with quite a number of OFC'rs and have not found one, (maybe with the exception of the pink tu-tu guy), that I would not fish with again given the opportunity. We all have quirks, ideosyncracies and god forbid personalities. Don't judge us by our covers, you will miss out on some great times.  By the way, I need a ride at Lakair this year...................  John...
Yep....and I have a couple of guys who are "friends" but after a fishing trip.....we're still friends, we just don't fish together!
I think you already know the answer, Wayne!  Mike
How very very true....  Im pretty reasonable on here but a complete **** in real life... lol..  ask anyone,,    and "troll not less ye be trolled"  and as for the pink tutu guy.... you wish!!!!
Many of us can attest to that............
I TRY to be the same on-line as I am in person, but actually, I'm louder in person. LOL  Pam
you should wait for an invite before you refuse, i doubt any of those invites will be coming anytime soon
I don't fish with anyone that takes 4 years to realize anything.
LMDAO!!!!! OHHHH THAT WAS GOOD.  Me i am just as crazy in real life as i am on the net.........But lovable with it.
Yes I can attest that Nauti is just as crazy in real life as online.. perhaps more so!
Errmmm excuse me but u left out the lovable too you brat!  SLAP!!!!
Am I suppose to care what this person thinks?
Not really!

Come on man, it's a message board....  I couldn't count how many times I've put my foot in my mouth on OFC just because my dry sense of humour never seems to come out properly in print...  How could you possibly tell how a person could be by some posts on a message board??  If I say "go screw yourself".  Could be a joke, could be an insult, I could be talking about changing a lightbulb.  Remove the body language and context and you have no idea what I'm saying...  Trust me, It's come out all too wrong for me a couple of times on this board so I know from personal experience that your analogy is nonesense..

Time for a big OFC group hug  Let nobody dare to 'dis' one of our clan ... that the musky gods frown forever on his offerings .. and the trout gods make his roe stink like owldroppings ... and even the rock bass (king of all sportfish) turn up their noses at his worm.
... and may the noctournal discharge of 1000 "poxed" camels fester upon his bed pillow for fourtnight!
It would appear he's just been fishing with all of us  Guess we don't need to take him now  Joey

That doesn't sound too bad to me. Although, had I written that sentence, it would have been "After more than 4 years of reading peoples' posts on this board, I find it interesting that I think I can tell with reading 2 or 3 posts from someone, that I would love to spend a day fishing with them in MY  boat.

Ya fish in my boat it likely means you're going to have to stay in my teepee a couple days, play with my kids, make nice with my woman, and smoke sweet grass ti'll yer left lung gives out.  You better be what you are online cause there's alot of bugs outside the comfort of my door.  I choose wisely and have done so so far.

Hahaha, great saying MB.  Paul always says that if they have the show Survivor in Canada, they should have it up north in the spring, then you'll tell the real survivors from the wusses when the mosquitos and blackflies come out.  It would probably be a short show, unless Canadians were in it.  Joey

After more than 4 years of reading peoples' posts on this board, I find it interesting that I think I can tell with reading 2 or 3 posts from someone, that I would love to spend a day fishing with them in their boat.  And then there are others that I don't think I would get in their boat if mine just sank right beside them. What an interesting cross section of people that like to fish.
Good thing we know so much about you...
You dont truly know anybody until you've actually fished with them. I always make it a rule not to judge a book by its cover. I guess thats just me though.
Good rule Rich!  Also, some people act much different on the internet.  The quietest, shyest person in the world might be the biggest "smack talker" on OFC! haha  uf
Well said Pigeon.  Weird post Outahere.  I'm not sure I'd want you in my boat.....LOL  Corn Nug
Let me see....I think it goes like this...."Judge not-lest ye be judged"
It takes (on average) ten years to really get to know a person!
Nipissing, please tell me your display pic is from the summer and not this pass weekend!
don't fish with Rizzo...he's a jerk and always catches the biggest fish
Wish it was my boat!
Does it matter if they cast or do you prefer to Troll?
I wait till 6 post to decide.......lol
An internet personlaity can be 100% diffferent then real life. I'm sure we all know someone that is completly different in real life then on the net.
.....................................Or one day in a boat!! I've spent a day in a boat with a stranger and sometimes know more about him than some of his friends.
Terry  - thats funny stuff  - 6 posts  - LOL    Don
Yeah, like me!  I have definately "profiled" a few people around here. Most of us are nuts.
LOL...Tracker I did mean for it to be funny I wasn't making a statement about the guy.......just thought it was funny

There's somebody with a signature on this or the last board that goes something like..."Creeps and jerks can't conceal themselves for long on a fishing trip" and I believe it. I would fish with anybody on this board at least once... after that....................
Terry you took the words right out of my mouth.  By the way ... welcome to our humble community ... lurk for 4 years ... but the 6th post tells all.
Ouch! That's gotta sting!
Thats DustinK's signature line, and have used it in a couple of conversations myself with other people,
I'm the nicest guy you'll ever meet outahere. I've had a few OFNCers in my boat. They seemed O.K. in person, but I didn't like their posts so I made them swim back to shore.  Wanna go fishing ?
I wouldnt fish with that Carp guy.  He makes faces at invisible rock bass. Weird.
anyone who fishes will have something good to say or at least a few stories
